author: potuz
content: Posting here cause otherwise will be lost on interop. Prysm will allow BLS changes to be included in the pool before Capella. Do you guys thing we should be broadcasting these as soon as we subscribe or after the fork?

author: ajsutton
content:
Currently you’d need to wait until the head block of your peers is in Capella or it will be rejected as invalid because gossip is validated against the current head state. 
Hence Teku just rejects bls changes before Capella because they aren’t going to be gossiped reliably and users are better off submitting later and avoiding the gossip chaos.

author: potuz
content: yeah I was thinking on broadcasting twice: once at subscription and then again at the fork epoch

author: potuz
content: but I am worried of being banned or something if doing it before the fork

author: potuz
content: if clients mark them as invalid and then don't take them again.

author: potuz
content: Prysm will take them as valid if it gets them from gossip before Capella, as long as they are signed correctly with the Capella fork

author: ajsutton
content: The problem is that once they're seen and marked invalid, they will be ignored even if received again after the Capella fork.

author: ajsutton
content: ignored in this case meaning treated as duplicate - likely the libp2p layer will remember them as invalid but not sure of the details of that.

author: pietjepuk
content: I have no idea of the exact numbers, but for sure there are at least _some_ stolen mnemonics (of validators with 0x00 credentials). So if the cutoff is the Capella fork, I do expect at least a little burst/rush/spam to get those withdrawal credential changes in.

author: potuz
content: yeah this is my biggest worry, then gossiping right at the fork may be a problem as well.

author: potuz
content: Yeah, but that's not that much of a problem if the biggest pools have them whitelisted in their operations pool already

content: Not sure if there's any whitelisting tbh, I thought that idea had died. I'd say that I'd still expect spam regardless.
